description: unusable, I found almost impossible to work on start date, end date with duration, changing one is reverted by the other.

Installed in Ubuntu 18.03 LTS MATE 1.20.1

Nice project scheduling tool, however it is a bit of a pain to have to always start from the terminal. No icons in menu or tray and can bind (when app is active) to plank.
I can't change the font size.

please fix the icon, when installing on Ubuntu it does not appear as though its been installed so I have to go back to software installer and launch from there (as it does recognize that its been installed).
summary: Looks good but no start icon so it's a pain to use

description:
Project Libre is my go to project management software in Ubuntu. 

The bad things about it with the new revision as of 2019 Sept:
1. The launcher - what happenned to it? Now I need to go back to Ubuntu Software to launch the application. This is very irritating. This app will make it into more 4 to 5 star ratings if this didn't happen.
2. The 1 page printing still fails to print to 1 page. It will always make sure that I get the 2nd page with the last line there. I now make it print a blank line there by putting spaces as description in the last line.
summary: Recommended due to similarities to MS Project

description: The latest update fixes the start menu entry, so no need to use the terminal to start it anymore!

It's about a tiny sixth of the screen on my XPS 15's 4k monitor. Perhaps if I could find a way to add -Dsun.java2d.uiScale=2.5 to the snap.yaml's JAVA_OPTIONS all would be good, but of course that's in a read only file system protected by APPARMOUR and my god... I just want to be able to work on my project files without a magnifying glass, not learn how to package my own snaps... gah! Perhaps if the projectlibre .snap exposed a snap configuration so that one could nudge it's uiScale?!?
have to start app from terminal. ubuntu 19.03
summary: Good concept takes work to start

description:
I opened, effectively, existing MS Project file, but after hours of work, the application is saving my work in special format that is not transferable to MS Project, which wasted my time.

I thought it was built to give people space of freedom outside Microsoft, but it seems building a jail 

My recommendation is to use it only if you want to be coupled with it, and none can't use it without ProjectLibre application installed.
summary: Nice to import MS Project files, but not to saving MS format again

description:
Saw the reviews and was almost not going to install. I mean, pfft no icon... forget that! Who wants free software if there's no desktop icon. 

Especially when you have to read like one whole paragraph about how to make your own desktop icons.

Luckily I'm lazy, so I hit launch and when I saw the program's icon I right-clicked and then selected add-to-favorites. Now I have a desktop icon without having to make a \*.desktop file.

:wq ~/sheesh.txt
summary: Update now includes an amazing ICON!

description: This is a great alternative, and they have added a launcher icon.
I've used ProjectLibre for a long time, on last version I'm saying thanks and goodbye, I've lost a lot of hours trying to open several projects, and I'll have to rebuild them on another platform.
The snap can't access files on other partitions.
summary: the app is ok but the snap is unusable

description: Is an excelente offimatic tool
The program changes dates of your event as it wishes with no warning or explanation even on already saved versions of your project.
summary: Buggy as Hell, impossible to use

description: This really useful as alternative to MS project. Love it.

Yes, I've only been using it for half an hour and I should RTFM, however, the UX (User eXperience) is unnatural to say the least. Fails to match standard procedures like select and deleting entries, scrolling down a list with the mousewheel etc. Pasting carefully formatted data is unpredictably problematic for unfathomable reasons (row 4 jumps to below 34). Added to which, outside the USA, weeks start on Monday and Sunday is part of the weekEND. Some project tasks are to be measured in hours, not days. Clunky, clunky, clunky. Yes, I know... don't moan, but learn and help it improve, but I'm not impressed and wonder if it is worth the effort... I'll persist a little longer. Three stars since I've not made my mind up given that these are initial responses.
summary: Terrible learning curve UX - like learning a strange, 80's GUI

description: On Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. Works just fine, no issues. The UI looks old school... for me, love it and straight to the point. I'm using this for my personnel dev projects. Plus, totally free.
Really good app for basic gantt charts etc.
summary: It's a pretty passable alternative to MS project

description: 100% recomendable

Considero que deben agregarle permisos para poder acceder y grabar archivos desde medios externos como USB o Discos extraibles.
Al permitirlo, hacen que la herramienta sea mucho mas poderosa.
summary: Muy buena Herramienta, solo le falta agregar algunos permisos
